verses.text: And God remembered Noah , and every living thing , and all the cattle that \add was\add* with him in the ark : and God made a wind to pass over the earth , and the waters asswaged ;
The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped , and the rain from heaven was restrained ;
And the waters returned from off the earth continually : and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.\f + \fr 8.3 \ft continually: Heb. in going and returning\f* \p
And the ark rested in the seventh month , on the seventeenth day of the month , upon the mountains of Ararat.

And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month : in the tenth \add month\add*, on the first \add day\add* of the month , were the tops of the mountains seen.\f + \fr 8.5 \ft decreased…: Heb. were in going and decreasing\f* \p
¶ And it came to pass at the end of forty days , that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made :
And he sent forth a raven , which went forth to and fro , until the waters were dried up from off the earth.\f + \fr 8.7 \ft to…: Heb. in going forth and returning\f*
Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground ;

But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot , and she returned unto him into the ark , for the waters \add were\add* on the face of the whole earth : then he put forth his hand , and took her , and pulled her in unto him into the ark.\f + \fr 8.9 \ft pulled…: Heb. caused her to come\f*
And he stayed yet other seven days ; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark ;
And the dove came in to him in the evening ; and, lo, in her mouth \add was\add* an olive leaf pluckt off : so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
And he stayed yet other seven days ; and sent forth the dove ; which returned not again unto him any more. \p

¶ And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year , in the first \add month\add*, the first \add day\add* of the month , the waters were dried up from off the earth : and Noah removed the covering of the ark , and looked , and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
And in the second month , on the seven and twentieth day of the month , was the earth dried. \p
¶ And God spake unto Noah , saying ,
Go forth of the ark , thou, and thy wife , and thy sons , and thy sons’ wives with thee.

Bring forth with thee every living thing that \add is\add* with thee, of all flesh , \add both\add* of fowl , and of cattle , and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth ; that they may breed abundantly in the earth , and be fruitful , and multiply upon the earth.
And Noah went forth , and his sons , and his wife , and his sons’ wives with him:
Every beast , every creeping thing , and every fowl , \add and\add* whatsoever creepeth upon the earth , after their kinds , went forth out of the ark.\f + \fr 8.19 \ft kinds: Heb. families\f* \p
¶ And Noah builded an altar unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and took of every clean beast , and of every clean fowl , and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* smelled a sweet savour ; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said in his heart , I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake ; for the imagination of man’s heart \add is\add* evil from his youth ; neither will I again smite any more every thing living , as I have done.  +  r 8.21  t a sweet…: Heb. a savour of rest or, satisfaction *  +  r 8.21  t for the imagination: or, through the imagination *
While the earth remaineth , seedtime and harvest , and cold and heat , and summer and winter , and day and night shall not cease.\f + \fr 8.22 \ft While…: Heb. As yet all the days of the earth\f*
